text: I've debugged this couple of days ago.. there is something wrong with some http2 frame (!)
I thought I did something wrong with versions, so went and undid all my version updates of protoc, grpc, gradle.... and so on.. and back to the same problem..
any thoughts, ideas, tips to try appreciated..
are you able to try it on a linux/windows machine?
should be..
was gonna do that next..
need to rebuild all the baseimages on my x linux laptop.. just takes hours..
apropos.. would appreciate comments on the changes I will be proposing.. (github link above)
especially how they affect javaenv
some very creative gymnastics there
atm trying to reproduce my debugging session from couple of days back.. I had a very creative -Xdump option to print me backtraces onError()
<@U0YQK8WSV> I also got IBM java for ppc and z..
(my old team :slightly_smiling_face: )
you are compiling protoc as part of the patch.. may be google can include that as pre-built binary?
they dont have a prebuilt one for z
and suspect not for ppc, but havent checked
was talking to Greg Haskings.. perhaps instead of java:8 as base, use baseimage?
i am working on getting rid of dependency on protoc.. made good progress... used antlr and stringtemplates to parse and generate the code for java.. so that all we need is a jar file..
oh!
next gradle!?
notice the patches?
gradle....... I got a very long rant I am gonna hold in :smile:
well.. never used it before.. painful learning curve on unsuported platform
:slightly_smiling_face: not gradle replacement or anything.. just didn't want protoc dependency..
but I fixed it I did!!!
lol
like Java very much since I was on the JIT team for many years so if anything, what this to run!!
but making java platform dependent!? wha!?
only gradle..
another option for not compiling protoc on x.. pull that compile out to a script.. so I can stick an if into it
yes.. just making it on dependent on java build tools .. that way it flows well with building java projects..  add dependency from maven repo..and not worry about pre-built protoc binaries or plugins
if on x download
as long as what maven downloads is pure java, should be no problem..
yes..that's what I am hoping to achieve
<@U2NG5AX0A|klorenz> has joined the channel
<@U10Q62R8X> .. we are moving shim layer to fabric-sdk-java.. that would change some of the buildfiles
ah..

<@U0YQK8WSV> ...just trying to get started using this Java SDK for Hyperledger Fabric...when I pull it down I get lots of compile errors for missing imports...if I run the maven build is that going to resolve?  For example org.hyperledger.protos.*
mvn compile
yes..
<@U0YQK8WSV> great that worked, thanks

<@U0YQK8WSV> I tried to bring in the jar to a client project and use the objects but seems like missing a lot of the Maven dependency jars, are those all suppose to be rolled into the fabric-java-sdk-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
<@U2NDE1ZCK> yes you will need these dependencies included in your target project
we'll update the dependency list in read me
